column4: ndiswrapper notes the driver to my wireless card was installed correctly and the hardware is present, but iwconfig / ifconfig do not list wlan0... what do I do if I can't configure wlan0? It acts like it doesn't exist!
reinsert the card?
I have to uninstall the driver for the system to boot past "Configuring Network Interfaces"
do you mean it hangs on ndiswrapper driver at boot?
or 'loading ndiswrapper' or whatever?
that is probably what it is, but it never mentions ndiswrapper
sometimes it's the simple things we miss :)
that sounds like the problem...
how do I prevent ndiswrapper from stalling at boot? should I try reinstallation?
oh!
which card is this?  are there any other wifi driver modules loaded?  if so you might need to blacklist them in /etc/hotplug/blacklist then reboot, same for you vessuvius81
It's a Linksys WMP54G version 4, the Ralink chipset.
I have a thread at http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?p=112897
it didn't help
lsmod|grep ath  -- any output to that?
I'll try that...
are you sure there aren't any other wireless driver modules loaded, i.e. with my dlink it loaded ath_pci native driver and ndiswrapper wouldn't work with it loaded
do i had to blacklist it, ath_pci along with it's associated modules
I'm looking for wlan0, right?
>_<`` I don't know what I'm looking for...
you're looking for a module loaded that is for wireless, i know it can be tricky :)
/query ok?
that's fine
